form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Vitter (for himself, Ms. Baldwin, and Mr. Kaine) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Energy to award grants to expand programs in maritime and energy workforce technical training, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training Enhancement Act.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate Federal agency means—

subparagraph.text: the Department of Defense;
the Department of Energy;
the Department of Homeland Security;
the Department of Transportation; or
the Department of Veterans Affairs.

paragraph.text: The term institution of higher education has the meaning given the term in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Energy.
The term veteran has the meaning given the term in section 101 of title 38, United States Code.

section.header: Maritime and energy workforce technical training enhancement

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall award grants to eligible institutions to expand on existing programs in maritime and energy workforce technical training, including by—

subparagraph.text: admitting more students to the program;
training faculty;
expanding facilities;
creating new maritime career pathways, including a pathway from an associate degree to a baccalaureate degree;
awarding credit for prior learning experience; and
increasing cooperation with, as applicable—

paragraph.text: To be eligible to receive a grant under paragraph (1), an institution shall be an institution of higher education that—

subparagraph.text: is a community college or other public postsecondary educational institution;
is located in close proximity to marine or port facilities in the Gulf of Mexico, Atlantic Ocean, Pacific Ocean, or Great Lakes;
offers a maritime training and education program; and
has an established association with—

clause.text: a port authority or other established seaport or inland port facility; and

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall give priority in awarding grants under this subsection to eligible institutions that have entered into a partnership with an appropriate Federal agency.
Grants awarded under this subsection shall be in amounts of not less than $1,000,000 and not more than $1,500,000.

Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter for 2 years, the Secretary shall issue a request for applications from eligible institutions for grants under subsection (a).

An eligible institution seeking a grant under subsection (a) shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require, including—

subparagraph.text: demonstration of a willingness and ability to participate in a partnership described in subsection (a)(3); and
a commitment and demonstration of an ability to maintain maritime and energy workforce technical training programs after the end of the grant period.

paragraph.text: An eligible institution awarded a grant under subsection (a) shall use grant amounts to carry out—

subparagraph.text: training relating to maritime or energy transportation, logistics, and supply chain management;
training relating to shipbuilding and ship repair;
enhancement of academic and workforce training programs providing training for maritime and energy employment, including certifications and apprenticeships;
salary supplementation for faculty in maritime or energy training and education;
operation and maintenance of maritime or energy-related equipment and technology for use in instructional programs;

acquisition of marine vessels, safety equipment, ship simulators, electronic navigation devices, fire suppression equipment, physical and chemical measuring instruments, sampling devices, and other assets and equipment for use in maritime or energy training and education;
renovation or construction of buildings to house maritime or energy training and education programs; or
tuition reimbursement for successful completion of a maritime or energy course, program, or certification.

paragraph.text: An eligible institution awarded a grant under subsection (a) may not use greater than 50 percent of the grant amount to carry out paragraph (1)(G).
To the maximum extent practicable, an eligible institution awarded a grant under subsection (a) shall give preference to veterans in admission to maritime or energy training and education programs.
An eligible institution awarded a grant under subsection (a) may use the grant funds for the 3-year period following the award of the grant.

subsection.header: Grant for development of grant program

paragraph.text: In developing the grant program under subsection (a), the Secretary may award a grant to an eligible nonprofit organization to provide assistance to the Secretary in carrying out this section.

To be eligible to receive a grant under paragraph (1), a nonprofit organization shall have not fewer than 10 years of experience in working with eligible institutions on developing workforce development programs.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section $12,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2016 through 2018.

section.header: Centers of Excellence in Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training

paragraph.text: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation and the Secretary of Labor, shall award grants to not more than 10 eligible institutions—

subparagraph.text: to establish within each eligible institution receiving a grant a center, to be known as a Center of Excellence in Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training (referred to in this section as a Center); and

through the Center established under subparagraph (A), to improve and expand maritime and energy workforce training opportunities for veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Federal employees, and civilians by—

clause.text: implementing new training programs, including training programs in—

subclause.text: maritime and energy logistics and supply chain management;
maintenance of navigation and deck cargo systems;
port-related transportation, logistics, and supply chain management;
operation and maintenance of equipment and technology for use in maritime and energy employment training; and

clause.text: providing job placement services in maritime and energy employment fields.

paragraph.text: To be eligible to receive a grant under paragraph (1), an institution shall be an institution of higher education that—

subparagraph.text: is a community college or other public postsecondary educational institution;
operates an existing maritime or energy workforce training program;
offers accredited programs in academic areas relevant to maritime or energy-related workforce training, including—

clause.text: port-related transportation, logistics, and supply chain management; and

subparagraph.text: is well-recognized in the field of maritime workforce training; and
has an established association with—

clause.text: a port authority or other established seaport or inland port facility; and

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B), the Secretary shall give priority in awarding grants under this section to eligible institutions that have entered into, or demonstrate the willingness and ability to enter into—

clause.text: a memorandum of understanding with an appropriate Federal agency; or
a cooperative agreement with an appropriate private entity, as determined by the Secretary.

subparagraph.header: Memorandum of understanding and cooperative agreement described
subparagraph.text: A memorandum of understanding or cooperative agreement referred to in subparagraph (A) shall provide for—

clause.text: the provision of resources, whether in cash or in-kind, to the Center; or

subclause.text: building maritime or energy training capacity; or
training Federal employees in maritime fields.

paragraph.text: Grants awarded under paragraph (1) shall be in amounts of not more than $1,500,000 per eligible institution.
Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall issue a request for applications from eligible institutions for a grant under subsection (a).
An eligible institution seeking a grant under subsection (a) shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require.
An eligible institution awarded a grant under this section shall use the grant amount—

subparagraph.text: to develop an agenda for maritime and energy training and education;
to fund expansion of maritime and energy training and education; or
to publish or otherwise disseminate findings relating to best practices in maritime and energy training and education.

paragraph.text: An eligible institution awarded a grant under subsection (a) may use the grant funds for the 5-year period following the award of the grant.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section $12,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2016 through 2018.
